sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &app; application allows you to browse LDAP-based directories and add/edit/delete entries contained within. It can store profiles for quick access to different servers. There are also different views available such as Users, Groups and Hosts which allow you to easily manage objects without having to deal with the intricacies of LDAP.

sect2.title: To Start &app;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

sect2.title: When You Start &app;
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed:
The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands you need to work with the LDAP server in &app;.
The toolbar contains a subset of the commands that you can access from the menubar.
The view area contains the different views of the data on the LDAP server.
The output window displays the information about entries found in the directory.
The statusbar displays the username that was used to login to the LDAP server

sect2.para: When you right-click in the output window, the application displays a popup menu. The popup menu contains the most common commands.

In &app;, you can perform the same action in different ways. For example, you can import an LDIF file in the following ways:
UI Component
Action
Window
Drag a file into the &app; window from another application such as a file manager.
Menubar
Choose FileImport LDIF....

sect2.title: To Create a New Entry
sect2.para: To create a new entry, choose ServerNew. Depending on the current view selected (Computers,Contacts,Groups,Users), the application displays a new entry dialog.

sect2.title: To Delete an Entry
sect2.para: To delete an entry, choose ServerDelete. The application will display a confirmation dialog before proceeding.

sect2.title: To Re-Login to a Server
sect2.para: At any time you can re-login to the server. Say for example you logged in with anonymous access and now need to do something which requires privileges. To re-login, choose ServerRe-login.... The application will display a dialog to get the new login information. The status bar will show who you are currently logged in as.

sect2.title: To Disconnect from a Server
sect2.para: To disconnect from a server, choose ServerDisconnect. The application will display a confirmation dialog before proceeding.

sect2.title: To Import Entries from an LDIF file
sect2.para: To import some entries from an LDIF file, choose ServerImport LDIF.... The application will display a file chooser dialog to select the file.
You could also just drag and drop the file from your file manager into the output window. This also works with plain text blocks.

sect2.title: To Export an entry to an LDIF file
sect2.para: To export an entry to an LDIF file, choose ServerExport LDIF.... The application will display a file chooser dialog to select the file to save as.
You could also right click on the entry and choose Export.

sect2.title: To setup your directory for Samba
sect2.para: To setup your directory for Samba, choose ServerPopulate for Samba.... You need to provide the following information and then click on the ok button.

note.para: You have the Samba schema installed on your directory in order for this to work.

listitem.para: SID - This is the Security Identifier for your domain. You can obtain it by running the command net getlocalsid
Domain - Name of your Samba domain
Administrator - The user name of the system administrator
Guest - The user name of the system guest user
Users - Where to store user objects
Groups - Where to store group objects
Computers - Where to store computer objects
ID Map - Where to store ID map (only needed if your server is a domain member server)

sect2.title: To Quit LAT
sect2.para: To quit LAT, choose ServerQuit.

sect2.title: Mass edit of directory entries
sect2.para: To mass edit some entries, choose EditMas Edit.... You will need to provide a search filter and provide the edits you wish to make.

sect2.title: Pre-defined Views
sect2.para: &app; comes with the following pre-defined views:

sect2.title: To create a custom view
sect2.para: To create your own view click on "Custom Views" in the View window and then choose ServerNew.
A view is just a saved search which display certain attributes. The fields for filter and base are where you define the search. You can click on the help button to use the search builder.
Once you have a search defined, click on "Test Search" and then select the attributes you wish to have displayed. Then save the view.
After it's been saved you can access your view just like any of the pre-defined ones.

sect2.title: To browse and LDAP server
sect2.para: If you want to just browse an LDAP directory, choose ViewBrowser.

You will switch to the browser view where you can collapse/expand different parts of the tree. Clicking on an entry will show it's attributes. You can double click and make edits to different attributes. To save any chances click on the Apply button in the Output window.

sect2.title: To search an LDAP server
sect2.para: To search for an entry contained in an LDAP directory, choose ViewSearch.

In the search view you can enter a search filter or click on the help button andu use the search builder. Select where you would like to start the search and then click on the Start Search button. The results will appear below

sect2.title: To broswe an LDAP server schema
sect2.para: To browse the LDAP directory's schema, choose ViewSchema.

sect2.title: To view/edit an entry's properties
sect2.para: To view and/or edit and entry's properties, choose EditProperties.
You can also right click on an entry and select properties or just double click on it.

sect2.title: To show all attributes
sect2.para: In the browser view, to see all possible attributes for an entry, choose ViewShow all attributes.

sect2.title: To refresh a view
sect2.para: To refresh your view, choose ViewRefresh.

sect2.title: profiles.xml
sect2.para: $HOME/.lat/profiles.xml
Contains the users saved connection profiles. Passwords are stored in the users' GNOME keyring database.

sect2.title: templates.dat
sect2.para: $HOME/.lat/templates.dat
Contains information on the users new entry templates.

sect2.title: views.xml
sect2.para: $HOME/.lat/views.xml
Contains information on the users custom views.
